hints.content:
We know the $\greenD{\text{total}}$:

There are $\greenD{12}$ ice cubes.


And we know the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$:

There are $\blueD2$ cups.

The quotient will tell us the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$.

In this problem, the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$ is the $\purpleC{\text{number of ice cubes in each cup}}$.
The quotient tells us the $\purpleC{\text{number of ice cubes in each cup}}$.

question.content:
Adam has $12$ ice cubes. He divides them equally into $2$ cups.

**What does the expression $12\div2$ represent?**

choices.content: Number of ice cubes in each cup
